metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5731 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in wp-admin/post.php inWordPress before 4.2.4 allows remote attackers to hijack the authenticationof administrators for requests that lock a post, and consequently cause adenial of service (editing blockage), via a get-post-lock action.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5731` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.2.4+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.2.4+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 4.2.4+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyseventeen - 4.2.4+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 4.2.4+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.4+dfsg-1').
